title: Question 23
prompt: Every year, a tree forms new cells, known as annual rings.
description: Choose the answer that best develops the topic sentence.
feedback: The topic sentence is “Every year, a tree forms new cells known as annual rings.” To develop this topic sentence, the answer should expand on the topic, giving more details. The best choice is: “Annual rings represent the amount of wood produced during a single growing season. An average year of growth represents  both lighter and darker parts.” This choice gives details about the annual rings on a tree. The other choices give details about how trees grow taller, their inner bark, and when they grow. These details don’t develop the idea of annual rings.
